Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: aroadwelltravelled
Reviews.Content: We travelled here on a long weekend and it was perfect for our needs. Located close to the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque, it's perfect if you are short on time and need to squeeze in the highlights of Istanbul. Rooms were clean and the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The view from their restaurant level 6 is breathtaking!!”
Reviews.Author: Yantz
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week for 2 nights there, the lobby was beautiful, the staffs were ok they can speak English and gave us Turkish delights the moment we entered.... There were 6 of us, some of us got spacious rooms than others... But all rooms are elegantly furnished... Location wise perfect, my room was unfortunately without a view just the road (grd flr) but overall I'm still reasonably happy staying there :) the staffs even taught me how to play their spinning yoyo ;) From the rooftop restaurant u can see the blue mosque and hagia Sofia!!! Go there night time and early morning to capture beautiful pictures

Reviews.Title: “You WILL NOT beat this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KevinGLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself have just got back from a 4 night break of Istanbul, and stayed at the Golden Horn Hotel. I'll keep our Feedback simple, but accurate : Location,Position, Service, Staff, Cleanliness, Value for Money, willingness to help you were all ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT. We will definitely go back again, safe in the knowledge that our money will be well spent. Dilek and her team really are all about World Class service, making this your ideal base for an Istanbul city break. We have never left hotel feedback before, but this is so good we thought others deserve to now. Go for it ! Kev & Maxine - London

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ahmedzert
Reviews.Content: It was my first Time , it was very very nice and Tina with her crew were very kind

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: VPD-000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights during my 10 day turkey trip. The hotel interior is really royal and nice. It is centrally located still quite place rather than busy streets of Istanbul. All locations are within 10 min walking. Staff is really helpful and pleasant. Always ready to help you. Information desk is quite well and informative. They will book for you excursions and arrange pick up services. Breakfast is very turkish and lots of varieties. Definitely recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Pierre C
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for a weekend break. The deluxe room is a bit small, but very clean and comfortable. Bathroom decent, but very small. Good breakfast on top floor with amazing views around. Choose the freshly squeezed juices, even if you need to pay 10 TL, rather than drinking the breakfast juice. Location is the best thing with this hotel, the must-sees are within short walking distance. Staff is ok, Nuri welcomed us warmly, most of them smile and want to help, others are just doing their job. Only problem was one of the breakfast waiters (bit of a half-wit), who felt free to shout unwanted, impolite jokes at my girlfriend, ruining our morning mood, but otherwise all was good at this hotel, you get what you pay for and a bit more !

Reviews.Title: “â€œEXCELLENT SERVICE EXCELLENT LOCATIONâ€�”
Reviews.Author: valery737
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with an amazing view, perfect clean rooms, tastefull kitchen, nicier staff, especially if i remember Tini and Tamari. Sevice is super! Vasily from Kiev

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tooty-89
Reviews.Content: I was having a holiday with my friend in this hotel ,Golden Horn Sultanahmet Hotel is the one that has got Good facilities, a beautiful hotel, a nice place for relaxation,breathtaking views from terrace . The room itself is very classic and clean. Well designed and clean bathrooms. After all, an excellent hotel in a nice stay.the location is very good too close to almost every tourist attractions. Staff is amazing , so friendly ,Tamara, Tina,nice people very attentive and executive girls.

Reviews.Title: “5 nights in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SherrenAnn
Reviews.Content: We wanted the complete Turkish experience which we experienced at the Golden Horn - the decorations & food were very Turkish. Location is great - the view from our very elaborately decorated rooms was the best part - The Blue Mosque. Aya Sophia & the Bosphorus right out our window. Tram 5 min walk as well. Hotel very clean & on the most part friendly. We had a conflict over the fresh orange served at breakfast. This is definitely NOT part of your paid for breakfast. Be aware - 10 TL extra will be added to your bill! We really enjoyed our 2 short ferry trips to Asia - people much more friendly & laid back there - not trying to hassle you to death to sell their wares. Thank you to Tina for all your help & diplomacy. Sherren & Keith, BC, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Calenates M
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located in a very calm place but short distance of all you want to see and visit when in Istambul. Gorgeous decoration and confortables rooms, but the most important are friendly people that works in the Hotel. Tina and her friend are always smiling for "good morning" when you arrive for breakfast at the restaurant. Then you feel good all day long. Around you can find good restaurants and good prices, even MacDonaldÂ´s for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: Billy T
Reviews.Content: The Golden Horn was an excellent choice for me and my friends!!Couldn't have asked for a better location, The room was very clean and cozy the cuisine was excellent the staff was very friendly and helpful, I would have liked to have stayed longer just to see Tina's warm smile everyday but had to get back to Canada. Next time I'm in Istanbul it's Golden Horn for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Golden horn”
Reviews.Author: Travel P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Golden Horn for 3 nights.Except for the location nothing is realy good like it was promised. Kitchen was closed due to renovation and we had plnned our diner t the hotel for we hve a 9 month old baby. After several email exchanges, hotel manager never mentioned it. About the local sght seeing, The hotel reception person gives pick up time 15 minutes late than the actual time.We had asked many times about the tour program if it was advised with a baby for a Bosphorous cruise, the nswer we got was Yes, it will be a total boat ride and 2 hours of Palace visit. It was not the case, there was plenty of hop-off in dfferent places.My husband had to go back with the baby. I will also blame the tour operators because I contacted them the previous day and they said the same story. Reception people were not too friendly. serious face and no smile. All that we had heard bout the place dint actualy come true for us... Room sizes small, toilet too small, no place to keep ur toilteries etc. Rooms were not claned despite the sign hung on th door outside I will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Enrico737
Reviews.Content: Rooms are superb, all personnel is kind and helpful, breakfast has a great variety of delicious food, location is excellent and transportation is just 50 meters away. I do recommend it for all kind of travel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Lefteris G
Reviews.Content: VERY CENTRAL HOTEL CLOSE TO ALL THE MAJOR ATRACTIONS WITH AN AMAZING VIEW. CLEAN ROOMS EVEN THEY ARE A BIT SMALL.BREAKFAST WAS OK EVEN COULD BE A BIT BETTER. STAFF WAS VERY KIND ESPECIALLY TINA THE HOSTES very central hotel close to all the major atractions of the citywith an amazing view clean rooms even a bit small very kind staff and very helpfull with a good knowledge of english special thanks to the hostess TINA

Reviews.Title: “location the best!”
Reviews.Author: silkman53
Reviews.Content: Only negative aspect is the bathroom.shower was too low and and could do woth a renovation. Location was EXCELLENT!!!staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: sarabizzoca
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here, everything from the rooms to staff to service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: rabbitoh52
Reviews.Content: My 5 friends and I stayed here for 4 nights and found the hotel to be in a great location. We first stayed 1 night then left to travel and returned to stay 3 more nights. Unfortunately when we returned for our 3 nights the first night they put us down in the basement in a very tiny room and we could hear all the people walking past and the restaurants and diners most of the night. We were not happy so the next 2 nights were spent on the 3rd floor which although the rooms were still small it was better than the basement. My married couple friends ended up in the Hagia Sophia room because he complained, the rest of us were female. On the whole we enjoyed our time at the Golden Horn, the reception staff were quite friendly and we had free wifi and free use of the computer. The views from the roof top restaurant were fantastic, breakfast was reasonable. I would recommend anyone stay here as the location is amazing and you get used to the small rooms in Istanbul, that's most of the appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Veryyyy Happyyyy with Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: roza a
Reviews.Content: Email sent to hotel after stay....We left without completing your hotel survey. Firstly, we had a very enjoyable stay at your hotel. When we arrived we were given a twin room, we asked if we could be changed to a double room and was given a very nice room with a wonderful view which we appreciated very much. The only negative point I need to make is that it would be good to have an English speaking channel on the television. I would think the majority of your guests would understand English than would understand the non-Turkish channels on the TV. And, it woud be good to have a sports channel. Again, we had a wonderful stay at your hotel while in Istanbul and hope to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Nur H
Reviews.Content: The location, the interior and Most importantly the service was flawless. Ä°, specially, would like to thank the brothers Adnan and Menduh for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great hospitality,”
Reviews.Author: Janis L
Reviews.Content: I was first time in Stambul , but I am very happy for my choice to stay in Goldes Horn hotel.The location is excellent - close to the major sites. The rooms are very clean. Breakfast is well done. As well very important is excellent hospitality of the staff specially - Tinatin Kiguradze . Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “just like returning home”
Reviews.Author: S R L
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to thank everyone at the hotel for being so helpful on my stays. It is close to everything. And a special thanks to Tina, Cana, Fatma, and of course Manduh. I look forward to me return visit

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Istanbul many times, and now, twice at the Golden Horn in Sultanahmet. The location is excellent - close to the major sites and bazaars. The rooms are very clean and new as well as spacious. Breakfast is well done and has more choices than you possibly taste in a single morning sitting. Most importantly, the staff service is outstanding. I want to especially note the helpfulness of Tinatin, Guest Relations Advisor and Menduh. They both go the extra mile to make guests feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: don't w
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Deluxe Golden Horn 2 nights in October.Clean and reasonably priced hotel with excellent hospitality of the staff(Saliha,Tina,Menduh and Fikret). Hugh breakfast buffet with breathtaking view of Sultan Ahmet from the restaurent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....clean...friendly staff..”
Reviews.Author: Margy0704
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Deluxe Golden Horn for 4 days in November , the hotel is beautiful, staff very helpful and the breakfast very good , although I asked a room with 2 single beds but when I saw up at the front desk wasn't arranged and they had no availability. Since, I am at the same business I know how important is this for two friends to share a double bed and believe me it is not nice , of course they told us to move the next day...but when you only have 4 nights to see everything you don't want to loose your half day in order to change rooms. I was wondering if in a way they could apologize ....but never happened. Also we supposed to have a view , as our booking was mentioned in booking.com but of course on the second floor the only thing you can see is the house next door.Of course If I had to go back to Istanbul I will stay in this hotel, but I will make sure that I will get what I have booked.

Reviews.Title: “THE most important person for them..”
Reviews.Author: Gigi K
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides an excellent services in all ways. Itâ€™s beautifully located with fantastic views. The staff speak good English, with careful attitude and you feel that everybodyâ€™s so helpful. The rooms are clean, every little detail is thought through and well taken care of. Being far away from home, from your culture and traditions, it is nice to find yourself in a place where people care about you as if you were THE most important person for them. I would specially underline Tika as a good professional and nice hostess. Personally, IÂ´ve stayed in a couple of different hotels in Istanbul in the past, and I always had problems. Things were inconvenient at times. This time my trip was perfect. Staying there was an absolutely pleasant experience. I will definitely stay next time and fully recommend this place for business & leisure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat the location ...”
Reviews.Author: Schull
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Golden Horn Sultanahmet in September ... the trip was a combination of business and leisure. From a leisure persepctive, it is hard to beat the location ... most everything is walking distance from the hotel. The staff were unobstrusive and effective ... buffet breakfast was very good ... room was small but beatifully presented and in truth we did not spend much time in the room ... we only figured out that the rooftop bar existed after a couple of days ... best views (at any time of the day) ... great staff ...

Reviews.Title: “Thank you tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is best located in istanbul . i was on a 3 day business trip to istanbul , i found this hotel from tripadvisor , everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel and spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: mary b
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Many of the major sites are within walking distance and there is a tram stop right at the end of the street. We found all staff members to be friendly and helpful- especially the restaurant staff. The restaurant is on the top floor and has great views of the city. The food quality and variety was excellent. thanks for everything

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with one of the best views”
Reviews.Author: Koka_Gh
Reviews.Content: I was on a two day business trip to Istanbul with a very short free time span. Hotel's location is perfect for such travel as it is comfortably situated close to major city attractions and sightseeing spots. Interior of the hotel and rooms are designed in a manner which grants eye satisfaction and feeling of comfort in a glimpse. service and comfort of the hotel are in a good and reasonable correlation with price. What I admired most in the hotel is the beautiful view from terrace and hotel room. Having shortage of time you can still enjoy and admire gorgeousness of the ancient city without leaving the hotel territory. Truly a beautiful place with long lasting positive memories.

Reviews.Title: “My Fifth Visit”
Reviews.Author: Murr85
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth to Istanbul and i have stayed in the deluxe golden horn hotel again, its the most lovely hotel in istanbul. The moment i entered the hotel feels like different world..the view fom the terras is ammazing no words can describe what you see..ammazing and fantastic view!!! eveytime i ago i found a new thing about this hotel :) this time there was a new lovely employee who speaks very good english and responsible for giving the information required by the visitors and suport them on all their requirments.. she is great :) The staff are just great, friendly and supportive. lovely people :) The hotel is very clean and tidy..food is very good :) Inside the hotel you feel like home :) The hotel location s close to everywhere, few meters away from all touriest attractions and tram stations ...no need to use taxi at all :) I really love that Hotel and planning to go again soon ..lovely Hotel in the greatest city istanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel amazing staff good price”
Reviews.Author: wienerschn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfectly located in the old city center. Grand Bazaar, Sultanahmet Mosque, Hagia Sophia and more touristic attractions are a few minutes walk away. Also, the tram station is 100m away from the hotel, which connects you to the city transportation system. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are big enough and the prices are well balanced. It felt like a great bargain! The hotel staff was amazing. They were kind and very friendly, Special thanks to Tina, the lovely lady helped us all the time, also gave us information about the city (i.e. what to do, where to go, where to eat etc.). I would stay in the Hotel Golden Horn Sultanahmet again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great spot, great staff”
Reviews.Author: sydneydweller
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in great spot - main attractions within very short walking distance. The staff were amazing - especially bell boy Menduh, who could not do enough for me, including going out of his way to make sure I knew which attractions were best, and how to get there. Guest services lady Tina was always there with a big smile, and they both greeted me very warmly and asked about my day's doings. It was as though I was an honoured guest or relation intheir homes. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “<3<3<3”
Reviews.Author: Anuki_anu
Reviews.Content: The hotel location and decoration is wonderful. Staff is friendly and helpful. We stayed there this month for a few days and enjoyed being there a lot. The view from the room was breathtaking. Some rooms are a bit small but beautifully decorated. Keep in mind that the hotel is alcohol free, but you could always get it somewhere nearby. Many thanks to the hotel stuff, especially Miss Tina for making our Istanbul trip so pleasant. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: pas m
Reviews.Content: Ä° went to Ä°stanbul the last week with a few friends of mine. The hotel location is perfect, surrounded by all the touristic places. Hotel itself is very nicely decorated, they welcome you with a Welcome cocktail, which is a very nice gesture. The hotel staff is very warm and friendly. Miss Tina is very attentive and always ready to help. Housekeeping is good, the rooms are always clean. Having breakfast on the top floor with the amazing view of sultanahmet mosque and hagia sofia is priceless. We enjoyed our stay a lot, we will definitely go back! from Pascial and Simon

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jan C
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in the Golden Horn Hotel for two nights. We were treated like royalty. We were amazed when we were given a different room, just because the one lightbulb was not working. After a two week cruise we were invited to leave our luggage in the hotel and walk around Istanbul without any worries. That afternoon Tina en Menduh organized a shuttle to take us to the airport. Thank you for a wonderfull stay, beautifull rooms and amazing service. Specially Tina, Menduh and Fatma.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fred B
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent! I enjoyed being so close to the blue mosque, hagia sofia, grand bazaar, etc. The hotel design is very nice and the staff is friendly and very helpful. Thank you Tina and Menduh for being so helpful during my stay! Breakfast had a wide choice and the view of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia from the top floor teras is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great view of the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a pretty and interesting lobby with leather furniture and ornate decoration. The hotel staff are attentive, most speak English well enough to serve your needs. The rooms are well appointed, ornate in decor, but very clean and nice. The bathroom is modern and immaculate. The breakfast is served in their upstairs restaurant with a drop dead gorgeous view of the Blue Mosque. The breakfast includes wonderful homemade yogurt, lots of interesting Turkish pastries and salads and olives. Theri location is ideal for sightseeing at the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, the Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. There are very nice restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: NomadLand12
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel woth a very friendly and helpful staff ( especially Tina and Menduh). Great views and food at the Teras restaurant. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dragos_Parvu
Reviews.Content: The location, the view from the rooms and from the last floor restaurant and last but not least the variety of the breakfast menu, tuned this stay into an excellent Istanbul experience. For greater details, check our photos. By all means, we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best view”
Reviews.Author: vanessaclm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, you are near of all touristic points and you can do almost everything just walking. The room and breakfest are really nice but the high point is the view on the last floor. In front of you are the Sophia Museum (left side) and Blue mMsque (rigth side). Simply Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Roof Top View Main Attraction”
Reviews.Author: Forever_Fifty
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in September at end of our Turkey vacation. Oppulent decor in lobby and rooms - some a bit too much for our taste. We had exceptionally nice rooms in other Turkish towns. Reception person was very snooty, a shock compared to friendliness of most other Turks. Other staff turned out to be very nice Had to change rooms after first night since shower leaked all over the bathroom floor. Had to complain a couple of times to get moved. New room shower leaked a bit as well. View from Roof Top is spectacular - single roof top toilet, not so much. Hair dryer a real pain for my wife. No place to put luggage except on floor. Free water bottles stopped coming after 2 nights. Location was convenient for walking to main attractions or catching the tram, but there appear to be other more modern hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay !”
Reviews.Author: beachbumpaul726
Reviews.Content: My wife an I were recently in Instanbul for the first time and stayed at the Golden Horn Sultanahmet, it was a wonderful experience. Centrally located and convenient to all the historic attractions yet on a quiet side street we found it to be a perfect location. The hotel appears to be recently refurbished, everything was in great condition and clean as could be. The rooms were quite and ours had a very romantic decorative light in the ceiling! An extensive continental breakfast is served on the roof top terrace overlooking the old city, a beautiful way to start the day. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful especially Onder, who gave us great recommendations for restaurants. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during September 2011 and it was the perfect location. It is central and within walking distance to the main tourist destinations. The hotel decor was historic and beautiful. The view from the roof top restaurant was simply magnificent!! The staff was wonderful and very helpful, in particular Mr. Bahadir Yasik and our bellboy, Onder. It was a fantastic experience and I will stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “The rudest management, the smallest rooms”
Reviews.Author: CultureClaire
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be as objective as I can about this hotel so people reading this review do not think I have a grudge or hidden agenda. My parents stayed here between 8 and 14 September 2011. I live in Istanbul and they were coming here for my wedding. My partner and I chose the hotel months earlier and looked at a Deluxe room (it was Easter and no standard rooms were vacant to look at). I should say here that a Deluxe room is one level up from a standard room. It was beautifully decorated and huge, so we logically thought that a standard room, even if half the size, would be fine. The hotel also has a lift, which is important for my father, who cannot climb a lot of stairs. My husband's brother-in-law is a travel agent here and he booked it for us and got the normal travel agent rate (about 20 Euros less than if you walk in off the street). When my parents arrived at 1am last Friday, I couldn't believe the way the staff behaved. An older man at reception started the check-in, then abandoned it when some people he knew came in the hotel. He started chatting while my parents (my father is 88) stood up waiting. When I asked if we could hurry because my parents were very tired, he was rude and dismissive. I've lived in Turkey for seven years, my husband is Turkish and we know that this kind of behaviour is totally alien to Turkish culture - older people are greatly respected and treated with care, as are visitors generally. Then we saw the room - it was a third of the size of a deluxe room. You couldn't both move around the bed at the same time, there wasn't space for a dressing table or even a proper wardrobe. The wardrobe was like a very long, slim cupboard, about double the size of a CD rack. We asked to be changed and they transferred my parents to a downstairs room of exactly the same size. The bellboy was clearly embarrassed but of course it was not in his hands. Apparently there were no other rooms available. After much calling the next day, the hotel agreed to move my parents to a deluxe room (at no extra cost), but said that it wouldn't be available until the Sunday, three nights after they arrived. They accepted this. In the meantime, my mother (and my husband, on the phone) asked for coathangers and a chair to put their clothes across - three times, before she eventually got them. They moved to the 'deluxe' room on Sunday and it was exactly the same size as the standard room, just upstairs. The bathroom was actually smaller, so you had to inch around the door to get inside. My husband and I came in the car to pick up my parents several times, and once we asked to park in the car park for an hour or two while we took them down the road for a coffee. Apparently this was 'forbidden', even though the car park was nearly empty. For balance and honesty I will say that they said the breakfast was huge and impressive (we saw the roof terrace and it has a great view) and the decoration and quality of the fixtures and fittings is very good, the air conditioning works etc. I can't comment on the gym or sauna as they didn't use any of those facilities. I am extremely upset that my parents were treated this way, as well as the fact that the room was terribly small. I believe now that the hotel management showed the biggest, most impressive room (natural, all hotels do this), but that they then accommodate people in box rooms after they have booked. Three years ago my parents stayed at Side Hotel, a completely different kind of place - much more basic and rustic with a simple breakfast (my younger brother stayed there this time). But for my parents, for our wedding week, we wanted them to stay somewhere a little more comfortable. However, when they come back again we will return to the Side because there we know what we are getting and the staff behave as if they want their guests to come back! (For clarity, I am not affiliated in any way with Side Hotel). Please don't stay at this hotel and make them richer! I am so sad and upset that my parents weren't comfortable this week.

Reviews.Title: “Golden days at Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rene055
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Ideally Located. Just a 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque/ Sophia Hagia/ Top Kapi Palace etc etc. GRRREAT location. The staff are friendly, but English IS a BIG problem. and water is always never there!! Tho' the Rooms can be a bit bizarre, Silver, white n Black striped walls! The breakfast food is GOOD, loads of cheese, breads, preserves, eggs, veggies n more. BUT be aware that at 10am, on the dot, irrespective, all food gets cleared away!!! and the view from the Breakfast table is. . . ASTOUNDING!! Great place to be.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Isola del Gran Sasso d'Italia, Italy
Reviews.Title: “I think this hotels is execellent..”
Reviews.Author: ihsan p
Reviews.Content: this hotel is wonderfull..i THINK if u want to go to turkey u choose this hotel..hotel hs got wonderfull place.. and it have got perfect rooms and servÃ­ce

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Terrible Internet”
Reviews.Author: MarketingDiva
Reviews.Content: Over all the breakfast and location were the best. But when it came to getting online this was next to impossible. It didn't help that most of the staff didn't speak English and seemed to not care whether we were able to use the Internet they so proudly said they had. There were several days you would find people littering the hallways trying to get a signal, or at the rooftop cafe stairs, since that was the best location for a signal. The wi-fi is definitely spotty at best. The location is great if you want to see the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, The Grand Bazaar, or The Spice Market, and other popular sites but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever :)”
Reviews.Author: Murr85
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time in the hotel and every time i have more fun that the last time. Great and wonderful view where you can see the lovely city Istanbul. I don't believe that there is any hotel can have the same view..The hotel location is couple of minutes away from the tram and all tourist places like the blue mosque and Ayaa Soufiya. The hotel service and food is great and lovely staff and friends. You can feel like home as you can feel too comfortable. I will stay in Deluxe Golden Horn Hotel every time I go to Istanbul..This hotel rocks ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Mizan007
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, staff were great, beautiful views (we were in room 511). Whatever you do, DO NOT VISIT THE FISH RESTURANTS. The morning manager Mr Fikret recommended we go to the YILDIZLAR, IT WAS A MISTAKE, THE FOOD WAS CRAP AND IT WAS EXPENSIVE (Â£102 gbp). Other than his recommendation to the fish resturant, everything else was great. We would go again and stay at the hotel but never will we take any recommenations from FIKRET again. (but he is a nice man) The hotel was clean and very well looked after, staff were great and pleasant. Breakfast, well we have had better, nothing to write home about, but can not complain. Only thing I would say room 511 air conditioning is badly placed and does not really cater for the whole room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: epaki
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Golden Horn during a weekend getaway in Istanbul. The hotel is situated in the heart of Sultanahmet, a stone's through from the major attractions of Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque - both of which you can see from the awesome views on the rooftop terrace restaurant. The people at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, while the room was really quaint and nicely decorated. The hotel is set back 1 street from the main thoroughfare in Sultanahmet, therefore the location is fantastic. There's plenty of restaurants and bars that you can kick back in and enjoy people watching, or just jump on the tram and take it down to the waterfront (or to the other side) or even go exploring in the opposite direction. Would highly recommend this hotel and consider it to be really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: hindalhumaidan
Reviews.Content: I visited couple of hotels in sultanahmad area in Istanbul and Im sure when I say that Golden Horn is one of the best there. The view from the trace and also from my favorite Room 511 is spectacular; I can see all the highlights in sultanahmad area. The ottoman style of the hotel is beautiful; every thing there clean and relaxing. Not to mention, the staff are such friendly and treat you like family; Menduh Barman who speaks arabic helped me many times and Salha in the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Raunaq99
Reviews.Content: You have to lose something to gain something !! The location of the hotel was just awesome !!! And the views from the terrace were amazing ! Those are the best pics we have and will remember turkey from those views. However, the hotel itself was quite back cos the rooms were small, room-service was quite pathetic, unprofessional staff & very basic amenities. We paid 150 euros per night so it was an average cost in that area. Overall, a 6/10 rating for the experience !

Reviews.Title: “Alex aydemir”
Reviews.Author: AlexAydemir
Reviews.Content: Ä° going firsth times this hotel location very good and services

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but service is hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: LuvTraveling8
Reviews.Content: Very fancy hotel, comfortable. The one bellboy was extremely friendly as one other of the concierge. However, there were three concierge who were extremely rude and gave poor customer service. I arrived early at my hotel 11am and check in wasn't until 12pm. The rude concierge dismissed me as soon as I walked up to the desk and asked me to wait at the side "for 5 min" while they served others who came and went after me. After 25 min of being fed up, I approached the desk again the inform them I wanted to check in and they said they knew but that my room wasn't ready until noon. I had to ask on my own to have them put my luggage in storage so that I could go walk around the city. They did not offer that and instead were going to make me sit around for an hour before they would even speak to me. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good place with an awesome view of the Blue Mosque and Sofia Hagia”
Reviews.Author: SudhanshuS
Reviews.Content: I reached the Hotel at midnight,kept my luggage at my room and went to terrace to look at the beautiful view of the Sofia Hagia as well as the Blue Mosque.The Hotel had a separate safe for each room near the reception area. The breakfast was good,the best thing about the restaurant on the ground floor is that it has a very romantic seating arrangement outside the hotel as well.My room had a small balcony,a wardrobe,a 22-inch LCD.The bathroom had a separate shower area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for The Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: henry5710
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare to find even for the taxi driver but once you've got there it has a fantastic view of The Blue Mosque, probably about the best in town. To get the best out of it you'll need to stay on the top (5th) Floor and get the corner room No 507. We did and we went to sleep looking over The Blue Mosque in all its glory and woke to the same sight in the morning. Simply stunning. The Hotel has a really great Terrace but strangely it's only used for breakfast service but a great palce to chill out during the day and evening. Rooms are good but vary in size so be sure to demand what's right for you, especially with regard to the view. Expect to pay more for the premiere room 507. Excellent breakfast spread. Lousy coffee. Rooms lacked ameneities like irons/boards etc. So expect to pay to get the case creases out! No room service here. It's basically a B&B boutique style. Well positioned for a plethora of restaurants/bars in Sultanahmet and, of course, the tram service, which is superb in ths City and so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Views and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: DiamondPearl32
Reviews.Content: Hi I have just returned for a 5 day trip to Istanbul and stayed at the Golden Horn in the Sultanahmet region. The hotel is just finishing its major renovations and it is major!! The hotel is being completly renovated inside and outside and when i was there they were finishing off some of the rooms and doing the reception area. Location: Fantastic 10/10. Only a 2 min walk from the main shops and tram service. There is a little garden area before you enter the main road so hotel is set a little back which makes it quieter and more suitable. 5-10min to Blue Mosque., Hagia Sofia and Grand Bazaar. By Tram only 3 stops to spice bazaar and Topkapi Palace. Rooms: Very Grand and nice. Go for the Deluxe rooms worth a little extra for the room. My parents room has nice double bed, a dressing table, a small table and 2 chairs and a wardrobe. With two windows - one balcony looking over to Hagia Sofia and a window looking at Blue Mosque. My room was a twin room with ample space. Lovely walk in shower. One downside to take into mind if going in peak times is that the walls are thin! We can hear people talking in next room in bathroom and in room, but as April was off peak not so significant. Breakfast and Terrace View: Breakfast is served between 7am to 10am. A very big buffet with everything and anything! Breakfast is exceptional. You sit on the the terrace which is glassed (or can sit outside) with views over istanbul and of the blue mosque and hagia sofia truly break taking !!!!!!! Istanbul itself: I found quite costly in terms of food and taxis. There were four of us but we would pay approx Â£35-40 for a meal and with all the added extras can be more! Taxis it is best to ask price before getting in, we found it easier to use tram service it costs only 1.5 turkish liras per person and if you get on at Sultanahment station (right in front of hotel) it will take you 3 stops to spice bazaar and Topkapi palace in one direction and in opposite direction 3 stops to grand bazaar. Its really easy to work out just look at the map or ask someone! always willing to help. You can walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, just head towards the building cutting through the park and it is very quick. If there is any other questions you would like to ask drop a reply or note to this post and i will try and help. Will post a pic of hotel in a few days. Overall Hotel was very nice, breakfast was fantastic, rooms were very clean and adequate. Location is fantastic, only downside walls a bit thin but if you are going to be out quite late and if you are not a very light sleeper (which i am) you should be fine. As we went in April (off peak) hotel was not full so was not affected too much. Hope I helped some of you with making a decision about Istanbul or even tte hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best View Ever”
Reviews.Author: moeniddo
Reviews.Content: i have chosen this hotel after reading the comments... the location was just perfect and the view is awsome and breath taking.... we really enjoyed turkish coffee on the terrace at night ..u have to be careful during breakfast if you are having it on the terrace, the seagulls might steal some of your food as it happened to me ... but it was funny.... it was great... the staff are more than great too .. they helped us a lot around and gave us lots of useful advice... the only missing thing is that the rooms are small but who cares to sleep, we wanted to enjoy istanbul to the max... I will be going to Turkey this month but unfortunatly i will not be staying at this hotel bec my friends already booked in an hotel in taksim .... but definitly i will pass by the hotel to have the turkish coffee on its terrace...

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: shah01
Reviews.Content: Great location. Pharmacy just opposite. Tesco like shop 20 seconds walk away which shut very late - all english food sold (1 miin walk on the right when you exit hotel just across the road - the one opposite was too expensive!) Located fantastically with all major attractions within walking distance - if u don't fancy walk, the tram is just round the corner (1 mins walk away). Great eating places on door step. Souvenir shops just across the road - some cheaper than bazaars. Hotel did not have tea facilities in room - but resturant very helpful. Take own iron - not sure if they provide. Small wardrobe for few clothes. Clean. Room serv excellent. Staff very helpful/friendly. Road is cobbled but good enuff for prams/wheelchairs. Hotel has lift. Good location/hotel for wheelchair users. Gran bazaar (10 mins walk), spice bazaar (15 mins), blue mosque (10-15 mins walk), sultanahmet mosque (10 mins), topkapi palace (must see - 15 mins), st sophia museum (15 mins away - just opposite topkapi palace). Would highly recommend. Staff/caterers/waiters...all brilliant! Almost everyone we met had an excellent grasp of english too.

Reviews.Title: “Huge renovation underway, but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Addismedia
Reviews.Content: Really a word of warning if you've stayed previously. As of February 2011, the hotel is undergoing a huge renovation with rooms gutted and completely re-done. We were warned about this and accepted to come anyway as we have been here before AND they gave us an excellent price. The work starts at 9.00 and goes on until 5.00 or so 7 days a week, but that's probably when you'll be out sightseeing anyway. The breakfast is still on the roof with the amazing views as before. The work is due to be finished by the end of March so take a check after that. Only come before then if you don't mind living in a building site, but with very friendly staff and a great location. We didn't mind at all but others might.

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Horn Sultanahmet Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Binbirdirek Mah. Binbirdirek Meydani Sok. No:148 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
